insights.kaplan_risk: LEGACY WARNING: Kaplan on head > 70m carries huge cavitation risk. Deep submergence (negative elevation) required.

insights.price_suspicious: Price significantly below market. Check steel origin and reference list.
insights.efficiency_high: Suspiciously high efficiency ({{value}}%). Physical limit is around {{limit}}%. Request IEC 60041 test report.
insights.rotor_width: Rotor is wider than access road.
insights.split_rotor_required: Mandatory "Split Rotor" design (two parts) or on-site welding.
insights.kaplan_double_reg: Large flow variations. Kaplan double-regulated is good, but 2 units (1/3 + 2/3) cover minimum better.
insights.kaplan_single: Stable flow, 1 large Kaplan turbine is the cheapest option.
insights.francis_part_load: Francis has poor efficiency below 40%. Better 2 smaller units to cover low waters.

frontBearing.name: Front Bearing (DE)
frontBearing.func: Primary radial support for the generator rotor shaft. Critical for maintaining concentricity with stator air gap.
frontBearing.heritage: The 0.05 mm/m specification originates from legacy Swiss turbine manufacturers—a gold standard that prevents uneven air-gap distribution.

rearBearing.name: Rear Bearing (NDE)
rearBearing.func: Secondary radial support, electrically insulated to prevent shaft current circulation through the bearing oil film.
rearBearing.heritage: Electrical insulation on the NDE bearing breaks the shaft current loop, protecting both bearings from electrical discharge machining (EDM).

groundingBrush.name: Shaft Grounding Brush
groundingBrush.func: Provides a low-impedance path for shaft currents induced by electromagnetic asymmetries in the generator.
groundingBrush.heritage: A worn brush leads to micro-pitting in the bearings, significantly reducing asset life. Check brush wear every 2000 hours.

lubrication.name: Lubrication Hub
lubrication.func: Circulates pressurized oil to cool and lubricate main turbine-generator shaft bearings.
lubrication.heritage: A clean oil film is critical for the longevity of sliding bearings under high pressure. Always verify ISO cleanliness code 16/14/11.

stator.name: Stator Core & Air Gap
stator.func: Houses the core and windings, providing structural support and defining the electromagnetic center of the machine.
stator.precision: Axial play < 0.5 mm at Magnetic Center
stator.heritage: The Magnetic Center is the axial position where electromagnetic forces are balanced. Operating off-center creates thrust on the turbine runner.

anchorBolts.name: Foundation Anchor Bolts
anchorBolts.func: Secures the generator frame to the concrete foundation, transmitting all dynamic loads to the civil structure.
anchorBolts.heritage: Tighten in a star pattern to prevent frame distortion. Never tighten sequentially around the perimeter.

jackingBolts.name: Adjustment (Jacking) Bolts
jackingBolts.func: Used during alignment to fine-tune generator position. Must be backed off after anchor bolts are torqued.
jackingBolts.heritage: These are for positioning only. Leaving them tight creates parasitic stress that mimics misalignment vibration signatures.

shims.name: Precision Nivelation Shims
shims.func: Stainless steel shims that establish the vertical alignment datum. Total thickness determines final elevation.
shims.heritage: Use a maximum of 3-4 shims per foot. Stacked shims act like a spring, compromising stability under dynamic loads.

runnerBlades.name: Francis Runner (Rotor)
runnerBlades.func: Converts hydraulic energy into mechanical torque through precisely profiled blade channels.
runnerBlades.heritage: Leading-edge erosion is the first indicator of off-design operation. Inspect blades every 5000 hours for pitting patterns.

spiralCase.name: Spiral Case Section
spiralCase.func: Distributes high-pressure water uniformly around the turbine runner circumference with optimized velocity profile.
spiralCase.heritage: The spiral geometry maintains constant velocity to prevent uneven loading on runner blades, reducing fatigue stress.

wearingGap.name: Wearing Ring Gap
wearingGap.func: Sealing interface between rotating runner and stationary components, preventing high-pressure water bypass.
wearingGap.heritage: A 1mm increase in gap can drop turbine power by >3%. Measure gap at 4 cardinal points during every major overhaul.

axialPosition.name: Axial Alignment Position
axialPosition.func: Defines the precise vertical depth of the rotor relative to the hydraulic centerline of the turbine.
axialPosition.heritage: Incorrect axial position creates parasitic thrust on the generator bearings, accelerating wear and reducing efficiency.

headCover.name: Front Head Cover & Seal
headCover.func: Provides structural closure and sealing for the upper turbine chamber, containing high-pressure water.
headCover.heritage: The bolted front assembly must maintain absolute sealing integrity. Bolt sequence follows star pattern for even pressure distribution.

guideVaneAssembly.name: Guide Vane Assembly (Wicket Gates)
guideVaneAssembly.func: Controls the volume and direction of water entering the runner. Click to Deep-Dive.
guideVaneAssembly.heritage: The 24 wicket gates must move in perfect unison. A single lagging gate creates asymmetric thrust that wrecks the steady bearing.

wicketGates.name: Wicket Gates (Lopatice)
wicketGates.func: Regulates water flow into the runner, controlling turbine output and maintaining hydraulic stability.
wicketGates.heritage: Precise angular synchronization determines the purity of flow entry. Any deviation > 0.1° creates turbulence that hammers the runner blades.

shearPins.name: Safety Shear Pins
shearPins.func: Protect the regulation mechanism by breaking under excessive load (e.g., debris jam), decoupling the specific gate.
shearPins.heritage: Never replace with standard bolts. Use only calibrated shear pins to protect the gate linkage in case of foreign object jam.

vaneClearance.name: Vane End Clearance
vaneClearance.func: The gap between vane ends and the head cover/bottom ring. Must be minimal to prevent leakage but sufficient for operation.
vaneClearance.heritage: Excessive top/bottom clearance acts as a high-velocity bypass leak, eroding surfaces and reducing efficiency measurable by 0.5-1%.

operatingRing.name: Regulation Ring & Linkage
operatingRing.func: Transmits servomotor force to all wicket gates simultaneously ensuring synchronized opening/closing.
operatingRing.heritage: Smooth operation relies on regular greasing of the linkage bushings. A sticky linkage causes governor hunting and power fluctuations.

genBearing.name: Generator Drive-End (DE) Bearing
genBearing.func: Supports the radial and axial loads of the generator rotor and flywheel mass.
genBearing.heritage: Supporting the significant weight overhang of the flywheel. Oil film thickness must be monitored continuously.

flywheel.name: Flywheel (Zamajac)
flywheel.func: Stores kinetic energy to stabilize turbine speed during load rejections and grid fluctuations.
flywheel.heritage: Never operate without the flywheel guard installed. The stored kinetic energy is immense and catastrophic if released.

coupling.name: Shaft Coupling Interface (Ø200)
coupling.func: Rigidly connects the turbine shaft to the generator shaft, transmitting torque.
coupling.heritage: Shaft run-out at this point should typically be < 0.03 mm TIR (Total Indicator Reading). Loose bolts here inevitably shear.

turbBearing.name: Turbine Guide Bearing
turbBearing.func: Resists radial hydraulic forces acting on the runner, maintaining shaft concentricity.
turbBearing.heritage: The bearing closest to the hydraulic chaos. If this bearing vibrates, check the Runner Wearing Rings first.

shaftSeal.name: Turbine Shaft Seal
shaftSeal.func: Prevents water from traveling up the shaft from the turbine casing into the bearing assembly.
shaftSeal.heritage: Carbon rings must be 'run-in' properly. A leaking seal floods the turbine, causing corrosion of the bearing housing.

section1.title: 15 Years of Field Reality
section1.content: Built on 15+ years of global site management and commissioning. We don't solve problems with code alone; we solve them with the knowledge of how metal, water, and pressure interact in the real world.
section1.quote: 'Discipline in the field. Integrity in the data.'

section2.title: SHA-256 Immutable Audit
section2.content: Every one of the {{dossierCount}} IEC 60041 compliant dossiers is digitally sealed. We eliminate the 'Human Factor' in documentation, ensuring that maintenance logs and sensor data remain tamper-proof for insurers and investors.

section3.title: Beyond Hydropower
section3.content: This framework is asset-agnostic. From Wind Turbines to Solar Grids, the NC-10.2 protocol ensures physical precision across all critical infrastructure.
